byline.contributor: An employee of The New York Times contributed reporting from Hilla, Iraq.

abstract: Suicide bomber attacks soccer game in town of Iskandariya, Iraq, killing at least 31 people; Islamic State militants claim responsibility.

headline.print_headline: ISIS Suicide Bomber in Iraq Kills at Least 31 at a Shiite Militia’s Soccer Game
headline.main: ISIS Suicide Bomber in Iraq Kills Dozens at Soccer Game

keywords.value: Islamic State in Iraq and Syria (ISIS)
keywords.name: organizations

snippet: The police say the attack devastated a crowd in the town of Iskandariya, south of Baghdad, at a game sponsored by a powerful Shiite militia.
lead_paragraph: The police say the attack devastated a crowd in the town of Iskandariya, south of Baghdad, at a game sponsored by a powerful Shiite militia.
